quote: It is grief that develops the powers of the mind.
author: Marcel Proust

quote: Grief is love turned into an eternal missing
author: Rosamund Lupton,  Sister

quote: Grief can be the garden of compassion. If you keep your heart open through everything, your pain can become your greatest ally in your life's search for love and wisdom.
author: Rumi

quote: But grief makes a monster out of us sometimes . . . and sometimes you say and do things to the people you love that you can't forgive yourself for.
author: Melina Marchetta,  On the Jellicoe Road

quote: Grief is an amputation, but hope is incurable haemophilia: you bleed and bleed and bleed. Like Schrödinger’s cat inside a box you can never ever open.
author: David Mitchell,  Slade House

quote: No one ever told me that grief felt so like fear.
author: C.S. Lewis,  A Grief Observed

quote: Grief does not change you, Hazel. It reveals you.
author: John Green,  The Fault in Our Stars

quote: Life is full of grief, to exactly the degree we allow ourselves to love other people.
author: Orson Scott Card,  Shadow of the Giant

quote: It's possible to go on, no matter how impossible it seems, and that in time, the grief . . . lessens. It may not go away completely, but after a while it's not so overwhelming.
author: Nicholas Sparks,  Dear John

quote: Deep grief sometimes is almost like a specific location, a coordinate on a map of time. When you are standing in that forest of sorrow, you cannot imagine that you could ever find your way to a better place. But if someone can assure you that they themselves have stood in that same place, and now have moved on, sometimes this will bring hope
author: Elizabeth Gilbert,  Eat, Pray, Love

quote: No matter how bad your heart is broken, the world doesn't stop for your grief.
author: Faraaz Kazi

quote: It's a time of sorrow and sadness when we lose a loss of life.
author: George W. Bush

quote: Someday you're gonna look back on this moment of your life as such a sweet time of grieving. You'll see that you were in mourning and your heart was broken, but your life was changing...
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

quote: It's so curious: one can resist tears and 'behave' very well in the hardest hours of grief. But then someone makes you a friendly sign behind a window, or one notices that a flower that was in bud only yesterday has suddenly blossomed, or a letter slips from a drawer... and everything collapses.
author: Colette

quote: Why so much grief for me? No man will hurl me down to Death, against my fate. And fate? No one alive has ever escaped it, neither brave man nor coward, I tell you - it’s born with us the day that we are born.
author: Homer,  The Iliad

quote: There is a sacredness in tears....They are the messengers of overwhelming grief, of deep contrition and of unspeakable love.
author: Washington Irving

quote: Envy, after all, comes from wanting something that isn't yours. But grief comes from losing something you've already had.
author: Jodi Picoult,  Perfect Match

quote: A break up is the closest thing to bereavement
author: Lindsey Kelk,  I Heart New York

quote: So it’s true, when all is said and done, grief is the price we pay for love.
author: E.A. Bucchianeri,  Brushstrokes of a Gadfly

quote: Every night when I go to bed, I hope that I may never wake again, and every morning renews my grief.
author: Franz Schubert

quote: How do you mourn something that never really belonged to you?
author: Rebecca Serle,  When You Were Mine

quote: Youth offers the promise of happiness, but life offers the realities of grief.
author: Nicholas Sparks,  The Rescue

quote: When we lose one we love, our bitterest tears are called forth by the memory of hours when we loved not enough.
author: Maurice Maeterlinck

quote: Here’s what I know: death abducts the dying, but grief steals from those left behind.
author: Katherine Owen,  Seeing Julia

quote: We have such numerous interests in our lives that it is not uncommon, on a single occasion, for the foundations of a happiness that does not yet exist to be laid down alongside the intensification of a grief from which we are still suffering.
author: Marcel Proust,  Swann's Way

quote: And perhaps it is the greater grief, after all, to be left on earth when another is gone.
author: Madeline Miller,  The Song of Achilles

quote: In times of grief and sorrow I will hold you and rock you and take your grief and make it my own. When you cry I cry and when you hurt I hurt. And together we will try to hold back the floods to tears and despair and make it through the potholed street of life
author: Nicholas Sparks,  The Notebook

quote: And I can't be running back and fourth forever between grief and high delight.
author: J.D. Salinger,  Franny and Zooey

quote: There are two tragedies in life. One is to lose your heart's desire. The other is to gain it.
author: George Bernard Shaw,  Man and Superman

quote: Relationships take up energy; letting go of them, psychiatrists theorize, entails mental work. When you lose someone you were close to, you have to reassess your picture of the world and your place in it. The more your identity was wrapped up with the deceased, the more difficult the loss.
author: Meghan O'Rourke

quote: Bursts of hope make despair harder to live with.
author: Bethany Griffin,  Masque of the Red Death

quote: When you lose a person you love so much, surviving the loss is difficult.
author: Cristiano Ronaldo

quote: This place is a dream. Only a sleeper considers it real. Then death comes like dawn, and you wake up laughing at what you thought was your grief.
author: Rumi

quote: For with much wisdom comes much sorrow; the more knowledge the more grief.
author: Anonymous,  Holy Bible: King James Version

quote: After you have wept and grieved for your physical losses, cherish the functions and the life you have left.
author: Morrie Schwartz

quote: Chase away sorrow by living
author: Melissa Marr,  Darkest Mercy

quote: Life is so beautiful that death has fallen in love with it, a jealous possessive love that grabs at what it can.
author: Yann Martel,  Life of Pi

quote: But to mourn, that's different. To mourn is to be eaten alive with homesickness for the person.
author: Olive Ann Burns,  Cold Sassy Tree

quote: You attend the funeral, you bid the dead farewell. You grieve. Then you continue with your life. And at times the fact of her absence will hit you like a blow to the chest, and you will weep. But this will happen less and less as time goes on. She is dead. You are alive. So live.
author: Neil Gaiman,  The Sandman, Vol. 6: Fables and Reflections

quote: The death of a beloved is an amputation.
author: C.S. Lewis,  A Grief Observed

quote: I know that it's easier to look at death than it is to look at pain, because while death is irrevocable, and the grief will lessen in time, pain is too often merely relentless and irreversible.
author: Robert Goolrick,  The End of the World as We Know It: Scenes from a Life

quote: Death, so called, is a thing which makes men weep, And yet a third of life is passed in sleep.
author: George Gordon Byron

quote: Disappointment is a sort of bankruptcy - the bankruptcy of a soul that expends too much in hope and expectation.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: My head is full of fireand grief and my tongueruns wild, piercedwith shards of glass.
author: Federico García Lorca,  Three Tragedies: Blood Wedding, Yerma, Bernarda Alba

quote: But hope, I can tell you, is an exhausting emotion; perhaps, along with fear, the most exhausting of all. It is like juggling eggs: the hope is the shell, and inside is despair. A single crack and the despair might spill everywhere, stain everything.
author: Sam Taylor

quote: Live to the point of tears.
author: Albert Camus

quote: But what we call our despair is often only the painful eagerness of unfed hope.
author: George Eliot

quote: Only people who are capable of loving strongly can also suffer great sorrow, but this same necessity of loving serves to counteract their grief and heals them.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Absence from whom we love is worse than death, and frustrates hope severer than despair.
author: William Cowper

quote: When you hold a grudge, you want someone else’s sorrow to reflect your level of hurt but the two rarely meet.
author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
